name: v2.6.4
body: - [JS: allow variable and function declarations of the same name, revert earlier change for redeclarations](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/2c5882a096909be935180223128ecf988a8c9494)

name: v2.6.3
body:
- [JS: Fix EmptyStmt Semicolon duplication when converts the ast back JavaScript](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/9d9c40e21e185813ef998145f0d0e93eceff20a1)
- [JS: fix when parenthesized expr has assignments for the same variable which only when interpreted as arguments for an arrow func should error](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/e61ad7abb4fac5fc29271320a0e9a6e5ee8abb21)

name: v2.6.2
body:
- [JS: add declarations in export default to scope](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/814e1da7655f17c109521af7be0ef425363ddcd4)
- [JS: syntax error for variable redeclarations](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/147a9238dc3e19acf82414eb0e22c591a0ee52cd)

name: v2.6.1
body:
- [JS: add errors for unterminated template literal, and improve error for unterminated string literal, fixes](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/254521cf6f43ac9d045d9342107767d3e8947827) https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/issues/98
- [JS: support private identifier methods and class fields named 'static'](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/877dfe9d34af6cadc28d39359a1e3f4f96018cef)

name: v2.6.0
body: - [JS: support static private class fields](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/dd86601a7fa91b9606f5f56c9ec806fa4b6857a6)

name: v2.5.33
body: - [JS: remove OptChainExpr and add Optional bool to Dot/Index/Call/Template expressions](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/71722cbfea1405cebd86bc9d9f46738418d7ac4d)

name: v2.5.32
body: - [JS: track function argument declarations](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/821dcb2c706272b7f2fe3eeee59f366515edac74)

name: v2.5.31
body: - HTML: fix attribute quoting bugs

name: v2.5.30
body: -  HTML: keep original single/double quote for attribute values as much as possible

name: v2.5.29
body: - [Add NewStaticWriter that does not copy the buffer](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/f5fc0e51344a413d01633c0675e9ba7fa83f9ce8)

name: v2.5.28
body:
- [URL/Data URI: space must be encoded as %20 not + as per RFC3986](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/7ecf472dc39043f2f4d09bc82c8bcba5add8893c)
- [JS: support parsing of numeric literal separators](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/ff140b1c713e060ba2a1fc9621a4103e56426548)
- [JS: fix variable renaming for identifier arrow function where identifier was already used](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/3a696f877e23726368415e6f513bb397e61dd0df)
- [JS: fix walk ClassDecl](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/6734237d078c9b4efd7a7760a389541c9a5ef7f1)
- [JS: allow strings in import/export statement lists](https://github.com/tdewolff/parse/commit/e4c61639421a49e850b02d9f3293606314be7918)

name: v2.5.27
body: - JS: parse comma-operator expressions as a list, not a tree

name: v2.5.26
body: - JS: fix WhileToFor option

name: v2.5.24
body:
- JS: const statement must have initializer
- JS: mark var uses in for statement parameters as different from declarations inside for statement block

name: v2.5.23
body:
- JS: change parsing around variable declarations for reordering improvements in minifier for https://github.com/tdewolff/minify/issues/445
- JS: allow identifier with Unicode escape sequences after the first character

name: v2.5.22
body:
- HTML: set Text equal to Data for raw tag content, fixes #84
- JS: fix JSON output for single-quoted strings, negative numbers, and return InvalidJSON form block en expression statements, fixes #88
- JS: make `JSON()` optionally implemented on AST nodes, see #85
- JS: `bytes.Buffer` now expected for `JSON()` instead of returning a string, fixes #85
- JS: implement top level `await`, fixes #87
- JS: add test cases for class field definitions

name: v2.5.21
body: - JS: allow line and paragraph separators in strings, fixes #82

name: v2.5.20
body:
- JS: fix let{e}={e} where second e cannot be a declaration when there is the possibility that it might be arguments for an arrow func
- JS: add JSON function, fixes #79

name: v2.5.19
body:
- JS: fix panic in `Walk`
- JS: fix parsing of `a++==b`, see #75

name: v2.5.18
body:
- JS: properly parse `{a:b=1}` when part of arrow function arguments
- JS: add `JS()` to convert AST to valid JS
- JS: add AST walker functionality

name: v2.5.17
body:
- JS: add variable scope to switch statement
- JS: parse async(a) as possible expression or arrow func
- JS: fix lexical variable renaming for descoped
- JS: fix import statement/call parsing at module level

name: v2.5.16
body: - JS: add expression level maximum for expression suffices as well (from fuzz)

name: v2.5.15
body: - JS: fix import statement/call parsing at module level

name: v2.5.14
body: - CSS: proper unicode range parsing with wildcards

name: v2.5.13
body: - JS: accept shebang comments at the start of the file

name: v2.5.12
body: JS: add support for class field definitions (see https://github.com/tc39/proposal-class-fields)

name: v2.5.11
body: JS: add &&= ||= ??= operators

name: v2.5.10
body: - JS: register directive prologues (`"use strict"`) as a separate statement

name: v2.5.9
body: - JS: support ellipsis operator anywhere in arguments

name: v2.5.8
body:
- JS: fix declarations with the same name as in the `for` initializer, see #69 
- JS: fix `var` declarations not adding their usage in all the scopes between its block scope and the function scope

name: v2.5.7
body:
- JS: put limits to the number of levels in statements and in expressions
- JS: fix import/export statements with one element in list

name: v2.5.6
body: - JS: fix errors messages that contain `%` symbols

name: v2.5.5
body: Fix position of error in error context with unicode characters

name: v2.5.4
body: - JS: add var decl as undeclared in block scopes between the current scope and the function scope, fixes tdewolff/minify#334

name: v2.5.3
body:
- DataURI: encode `\r`, `\n` and `\t` using URL encoding, fixes tdewolff/minify#329
- DecodeURL: don't decode when percent is followed by non-hexadecimal character
- JS: remove trailing commas in `var [a,,]`
- JS: variable declaration using BindingPattern must be followed by an assignment
- JS: improve parsing of `in` operator in for statements and arrow function bodies

name: v2.5.2
body: - JS: mark number of declared variables in for initializers in `Scope`

name: v2.5.1
body:
- JS: allow parsing `in` parameters in group expressions (that couldn't have been an arrow function)
- JS: store all comments in the head of the document (for license comments)
- JS: fix parsing identifiers in arrow functions, it used to assume they were part of the parameter list causing nil errors

name: v2.5.0
body:
- **Add JS (ECMAScript 2020) lexer and parser.**
- Add `parse.Input` and use that instead of `io.Reader` for input to lexers.
- Use predefined byte-slices instead of inline ones.

For users, there is a slight breakage of function signatures in this release: instead of calling for example `p := css.NewParser(r, false)` you should call

```go
input := parse.NewInput(r)
defer input.Restore()
p := css.NewParser(input, false)
```

or if the byte-slice behind `r` is not used anywhere else (which is generally the case), then you could just call

```go
p := css.NewParser(parse.NewInput(r), false)
```

This is for all lexers/parsers.

name: v2.4.4
body: Update `URLEncodingTable` and add `DataURIEncodingTable` for better URL/URI encoding.

name: v2.4.3
body:
- CSS: fix slow execution of selector with many errors
- Fix panic on MediaType that ends in a space
- Fix parsing `+` or `-` as integers, and don't parse the exponent if there is no number
- Fix parsing `e` as a float
- Moving hash tables/entities maps to `minify` repository
- JS: improved performance

name: v2.4.2
body:
- Add many hashes for CSS
- Add `amp-boilerplate` hash for HTML
- `NewError` now has fmt-style function signature
- Append 0x00 to signal EOF even if source already ends in 0x00 (which may be valid)

name: v2.4.1
body: CSS: add `Invert` and `Solid` hashes

name: v2.4.0
body:
- XML and HTML: `Text() []byte` returns `nil` for start tag closers
- XML and HTML: `Text() []byte` returns textual content for `TextToken`, `CommentToken`, ...
- Added `Offset() int` for all lexers and parsers that returns the current character offset in the input stream
- CSS: EOF after `\` now properly handled as `DelimToken` and not `EscapeToken` in some cases

name: v2.3.15
body:
Bugfix: bad URL encoding resulted in no decoding at all, the new `EncodeURL` and `DecodeURL` are faster and never fail
Bugfix: get correct `Position` if it is in the middle of a unicode codepoint

name: v2.3.14
body:
- Re-parse input immediately when encountering parse error. Previously this was only done if the error was actually read which would save us from re-parsing the file (i.e. better performance). However, an error is (a) rare and (b) happens only once per file. Re-parsing on errors does not impact the performance of well formatted files, and a reliable error message is valued more.
- Bugfix: prevent infinite loop on error on input file that contains unicode code points (i.e. any character bigger than `0xC0` usually followed by more bytes).
- Improve error messages for parsers to include parser name and print offending byte(s)

name: v2.3.13
body:
* Improve performance of `ReplaceMultipleWhitespace` by 20%--25%
* Add `ReplaceEntities` and `ReplaceMultipleWhitespaceAndEntities` to replace `QuoteEntity`. These allow to do replacements such as: `" => "`, `" => "`, `" => "`, `’ => ’`, `' => '`.
* Update list of HTML entity rewrites

name: v2.3.12
body: Revert v2.3.11 and readd `html.Keygen` hash.

name: v2.3.11
body: Add `ReplaceEntities` and remove entity replacement from `EscapeAttrVal`

name: v2.3.10
body: Add and remove hashes for CSS and HTML

name: v2.3.9
body: CSS: keep whitespace in unknown at rules

name: v2.3.8
body:
* Remove import comments
* Fix bug in CSS parsing when encountering `}` in CSS inline

name: v2.3.7
body:
* Fix position information on errors
* CSS: fix error position

- Prevent panic when returning `Bytes()` on empty buffer
- Set proper context in errors
- Limit the length in context in errors
- In `EqualFold` only match upper/lower case on alphabet characters
- Add option to `EscapeAttrVal` to handle attribute values for XML (use double quotes)
- HTML: add hashes for RDFa attribute names
- JS: accept NULL characters as code
- JSON: report errors NULL characters

name: Go modules support
body: Add Go modules support by using the `github.com/tdewolff/parse/v2` import path.

name: Fix CSS parsing of bad declarations
body:
- CSS: fix parsing of bad declarations
- CSS: handle comments within declarations
- CSS: reintroduce IE star hack `*color: white`
- CSS: add keywords to hash table

name: Bugfixes for NULL handling
body: This fixes a couple of bugs in the HTML, XML and JS implementations that caused out-of-bounds panics. The HTML parser now allows NULL bytes to be in the source.

name: Remove dependencies on buffer and strconv
Performance
body:
* Use a new buffer that holds all data in memory, giving significant speed-ups for parsing
* Speed-up JSON consumeString
* Break CSS selectors at the commas, this reduces memory requirements for (mostly) SASS/LESS generated CSS
* Add position tracking upon errors, showing line number and column in the error message

name: v2.2.0
body:
This v2.2 release is synchronous with tdewolff/minify v2.2

Changelog:
* JS: improved parsing of edge cases
* JS: allow HTML inline comments
* CSS: improved parsing of bad declarations
* CSS: parse custom properties

Thanks to @RReverser for improvements on the JS parser.

This v2.1 release is synchronous with tdewolff/minify v2.1

Changelog:
* HTML: foreign tags are now parsed entirely by the foreign parser (XML), not just their contents
* Unexpected NULL character error now returned by parsers

name: Performance
body:
This is v2 that works with minify-v2 and the buffer package. It is mostly a performance upgrade from v1.1.0. Also refactored tests and increased test coverage. Some minor API changes have been made, namely the `Next()` methods now return `TokenType` and `[]byte` but not the total shifted number of bytes (used for freeing up bytes from the underlying buffer). This now happens through calling `Free(int)` on the underlying buffer.

Changelog:
- functionality move between parse and other packages
- differentiate between (raw) `data` and `text` for tokens
- keep newlines when reducing whitespace
- keep bang-comments

Bugfixes:
- HTML/XML: don't panic on empty end tags
- JS: don't panic on EOF in template
- XML: don't panic on early ending CDATA

name: Zero-copy
body: This uses a more performant underlying buffer and which removes any need to copy byte slices. This release point is to be used with minify v1.1.0.

name: v1
body: This denotes a stable release point to be used with minify v1.0.0.
